item.title: Chicago Architecture River Cruise
item.description: Admire some of the Windy City's most iconic views—and enjoy a time-saving, relaxing way to sightsee—aboard this Chicago River architecture boat tour. With commentary from your onboard guide, watch the spectacular skyline glide by, including dozens of notable buildings, like the Wrigley Building and the John Hancock Building. In just one tour, you'll cover multiple branches of the Chicago River, and will learn insider facts and stories you'd otherwise miss.

image.alt: Chicago Architecture River Cruise

item.title: Chicago River 90-Minute Architecture Tour
item.description: Discover the architectural gems of the Windy City from an ideal vantage point on a cruise down the Chicago River. Offered several times throughout the day, it’s easy to fit the leisurely excursion into your itinerary. Covering more than 130 years of architectural history, the tour is the perfect opportunity to see a huge area of the city without the hassle of taxis and public transit.

image.alt: Chicago River 90-Minute Architecture Tour

item.title: Chicago: Gangsters and Ghosts Walking Tour
item.description: Experience a colorful side of Chicago history with this gangsters and ghosts tour. With a historian as your guide, you’ll step back to the Roaring Twenties, when the Chicago Loop was a hub for bootleggers, speakeasies, and gangsters like the infamous Al Capone. Visit onetime gangster hangouts and haunted sites like the Palmer House, Congress Hotel, and Death Alley. Upgrade to experience the tour by minibus.

image.alt: Chicago: Gangsters and Ghosts Walking Tour

item.title: Chicago Crime and Mob Bus Tour
item.description: Explore Chicago's gangster past on this mafia tour in a coach vehicle. Drive around the Windy City to see where Al Capone, The Untouchables, Hymie Weiss, and John Dillinger, among other thugs hung out. A history-savvy guide introduces you to some of the most storied locations of Chicago’s criminal past, including Holy Name Cathedral, Biography Theatre, and the site of the bloody St. Valentine’s Day Massacre. You'll be able to get out and pose for pictures in front of a historic courthouse, among other infamous sites.

image.alt: Chicago Crime and Mob Bus Tour

item.title: Chicago Lake and River Architecture Tour
item.description: Step aboard a boat for a comprehensive cruise that details the history of Chicago's architecture. Enjoy views of the Chicago skyline accompanied by architecture-focused commentary that points out each of the landmark buildings. As you cruise through Lake Michigan, snap photos of you and your party against the stretch of Chicago's 26-mile shoreline.

image.alt: Chicago Lake and River Architecture Tour

item.title: Chicago River 45-Minute Architecture Tour from Magnificent Mile
item.description: Get a front row perspective on the exquisite buildings that line the Chicago River during a 45-minute architecture cruise. Hear live commentary about the history and architectural heritage of Chicago on this family-friendly tour, which highlights landmarks such as the Chicago Riverwalk, Michigan Avenue Bridge, Wrigley Building, and Willis Tower. Sit on the open-air top deck or the sheltered bottom deck for the ultimate view of Chicago.

image.alt: Chicago River 45-Minute Architecture Tour from Magnificent Mile

item.title: Chicago Favorites Ultimate Food and Walking Tour
item.description: Stroll through downtown Chicago on this walking food tour. Visit Millennium Park, the Palmer House Hotel and other city landmarks. Taste quintessential Chicago foods such as deep-dish pizza, hot dogs, plus chocolates and pastry. All food tastings are included, and the tour covers an easy 1.5 miles (2.4 km) suitable for most fitness levels. A bike or kayak rental is also included in the tour cost.

image.alt: Chicago Favorites Ultimate Food and Walking Tour

item.title: Lake Michigan Sunset Cruise in Chicago
item.description: Drink in a one-of-a-kind perspective on the Windy City when you go for an evening cruise, perfectly timed to coincide with the sunset. Hop aboard your open-top vessel in the heart of the Magnificent Mile, and cruise along the Chicago River, where your guide will point out architectural highlights. Then, see the skyline from a distance, and watch the skyscrapers light up, when you continue to Lake Michigan for a sunset viewing.

image.alt: Lake Michigan Sunset Cruise in Chicago

item.title: Chicago's Delicious Donut Adventure with Underground Donut Tour
item.description: Sample some of the Windy City’s tastiest donuts on this Underground Donut Tour, celebrating the magic of Chicago’s tastiest sugar-filled concoctions. Donut-lovers are sure to enjoy this visit to some of Chicago’s tastiest donut purveyors, offering a chance to savor all of your favorite varieties, on the city's only donut-themed excursion. All tastings are included, and vegan, gluten-, and nut-free options are also available.

image.alt: Chicago's Delicious Donut Adventure with Underground Donut Tour

item.title: Original Chicago Architecture Interiors Tour: Dazzling Interiors
item.description: See the overlooked highlights of Chicago’s Loop district with a walking tour that takes in the best of the bustling, vibrant neighborhood’s inside spaces. Get behind the façades to explore stunningly designed interiors as you follow a specially designed route with an experienced guide. Learn about the city’s architecture, art and history while visiting a side of Chicago that’s beyond the tourist trail, and experience the Windy City with a local perspective.

image.alt: Original Chicago Architecture Interiors Tour: Dazzling Interiors

item.title: Chicago in a Day: Food, History and Architecture Walking Tour
item.description: An excellent choice for first-time visitors, this four-in-one tour provides a comprehensive introduction to the city's top landmarks, history, culinary highlights, and shows the legacy left behind by the Prohibition Era. With just a small group for company, you'll set off on foot to discover Chicago architectural icons and visit highlights like the Chicago Riverwalk, Millennium Park, and more. In between, enjoy generous tastings of beloved dishes from deep-dish pizza to Italian beef sandwiches and beyond.

image.alt: Chicago in a Day: Food, History and Architecture Walking Tour

item.title: Chicago River Architecture Tour with Small Boat Upgrade Option
item.description: Chicago is known internationally for its architectural diversity and dynamism—and this in-depth tour will introduce you to many of the city’s best-known and most influential landmarks. Meet at the pier right off Lake Shore Drive, hop aboard your boat, and set off. You’ll spy highlights ranging from Chicago’s skyscrapers and bustling Navy Pier to the famous “Bean” sculpture—and will learn about the different architectural movements that shaped the city. Upgrade your experience to a small boat with a maximum of 60 people, or choose the combo tour option which includes a 90-minute sightseeing tour of Chicago's architecture by minibus.

image.alt: Chicago River Architecture Tour with Small Boat Upgrade Option

item.title: Medieval Torture Museum Ticket with Audio Guide and Ghost Hunting
item.description: Discover one of the Windy City’s most spooky, gruesome destinations when you book advance tickets to the Medieval Torture Museum. Perfect for Halloween—or any other creepy-crawly occasion—this museum includes a wealth of information about medieval torture practices and devices, plus realistic models to add a macabre edge. Book tickets before you travel for a seamless visiting experience, and make use of an audio guide and included ghost-hunting app.

image.alt: Medieval Torture Museum Ticket with Audio Guide and Ghost Hunting

item.title: Chicago Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours
item.description: Explore Chicago's buzzing food scene—and see some of its best-known landmarks on the way—on this two-in-one walking tour. With just your guide and small-group for company (and the option to upgrade for a private experience), you'll stroll around the vibrant Loop area, spotting highlights from the Willis Tower to the Rookery building. As you go, indulge in classic Chicago foods, from deep-dish pizza to the world-famous dipped Italian beef sandwiches.

image.alt: Chicago Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours

item.title: Chicago City Tour with Architecture River Cruise Option
item.description: Explore Chicago's iconic landmarks on this sightseeing tour led by an expert guide. Board a comfortable, large-windowed minibus and explore Downtown and North Side neighborhoods. You have a chance to get out and visit several locations and hear about the historical and cultural factors that make Chicago unique. Upgrade your tour with a popular open-top boat tour on the Chicago River that focuses on the city's renowned architecture.

image.alt: Chicago City Tour with Architecture River Cruise Option

item.title: Chicago's Secret Interiors Architectural Walking Tour
item.description: See Chicago’s architectural treasures as well as some lesser-known, opulent interiors in this tour for architecture and history fans. Explore spots rarely seen by the public, with intricate domes, dazzling gardens, and noteworthy craftsmanship. Discover how architects and engineers overcame major structural challenges while creating these sites. You’ll never look at the city’s skyline in the same way after this tour.

image.alt: Chicago's Secret Interiors Architectural Walking Tour

item.title: Bikes, Bites, and Brews: Chicago's Signature Dishes Bike Tour
item.description: Chicago dogs, deep-dish pizza, brownies, and craft beer are all sampled on this half-day bike tour through the Windy City. Cover about 13 miles (21 km), following your guide at a moderate pace through Chicago neighborhoods. On the day tour, ride through Wrigleyville, Old Town, Lincoln Park, and Gold Coast. On the night tour, visit Chicago’s Riverwalk, Millennium Park, Buckingham Fountain and the Lakefront Trail. As you go, stop for generous food and beer tasters.

image.alt: Bikes, Bites, and Brews: Chicago's Signature Dishes Bike Tour

item.title: Chicago Gangster and Food Walking Tour
item.description: This tour stands out by pairing Chicago Prohibition era history with the city’s most famous foods—a rare combination. Tour the fashionable River North neighborhood while sampling local specialties at historic “gangster” hideouts: think of a steakhouse with a secret tunnel, and deep dish pizza in an old “gangster’s” mansion.

image.alt: Chicago Gangster and Food Walking Tour

item.title: Chicago Murder Mystery Tour
item.description: Bored of traditional walking tours? Try an experience that mixes sightseeing with an engaging game in this murder mystery tour through Chicago. Play as a detective and a suspect as you wander through various neighborhoods and see the city. Learn about the real legends and crimes of Chicago while you try to solve a murder.

image.alt: Chicago Murder Mystery Tour

item.title: Chicago Night Crimes Tour by Bus
item.description: Discover the ‘dark side’ of the Windy City thanks to this 2.5-hour, bus-based, nighttime crime history tour of Chicago. Explore the lives of notorious mobsters like Al Capone, Frank Nitti, Bugs Moran, and more as you explore infamous crime scenes like the St. Valentine’s Day Massacre, learn about ‘The Enforcer’s Safe,’ and stop by local watering holes.

image.alt: Chicago Night Crimes Tour by Bus

item.title: 2-Hour Guided Segway Tour of Chicago
item.description: Enjoy an active and entertaining way to explore Chicago’s highlights with this small-group Segway tour. Meet your guide at a convenient location in downtown Chicago, get acquainted with your Segway before setting off, and then hit the road. You’ll discover top Windy City highlights, including Millennium Park, the Buckingham Fountain, the Museum Campus, and more, all while learning about the city’s history and insider facts from your guide.

image.alt: 2-Hour Guided Segway Tour of Chicago

item.title: Chicago Pizza Tour
item.description: Enjoy Chicago’s only bus guided neighborhood pizza tour. Eat like a local as you travel off the beaten path into Chicago neighborhoods to savor the best pizza. Your local guide will teach you the science behind ingredient selection and baking as you sample slices from historic pizzerias. In just a few hours, you’ll leave stuffed, and with an understanding of why pizza is such an important part of Chicago’s culture.

image.alt: Chicago Pizza Tour

item.title: Field Museum of Natural History Admission Tickets
item.description: Delve into the world of natural history with tickets to the Field Museum in Chicago. Choose general admission, or upgrade to visit one or several special exhibitions. Spend as long as you like exploring the museum's collection of more than 26 million artifacts. Get to know SUE, the world's largest T. Rex, or stroll through the sparkling Hall of Gems. You can also take advantage of free daily tours led by Field Museum docents.

image.alt: Field Museum of Natural History Admission Tickets

item.title: Chicago's Chinatown Food and Walking Tour
item.description: Explore Chicago's Chinese food scene on this walking tour in the Chinatown district. With a guide, learn about the cuisine of different regions of China and how Chinese culture has influenced Chicago and other areas. Enjoy included tastings from restaurants and other food venues in Chinatown—a great way to start a night out in the city.

image.alt: Chicago's Chinatown Food and Walking Tour
